column5: tore rib muscles months ago, paying full price for massage therapy and chiro since wifes benefits ran out, if I don't work I don't get benefits or comp  a friend help put a used motor only 1 in Yellowknife into our 05 sierra went around block today only to find both front wheels cambered out,k bearings were replaced 4 years ago, no salt , truck back in driveway, wife has not had vehicle for 5 months, almost went to food bank 2 weeks ago little ticked right now sorry for posting just way beside myself right now,
Things will turn around for you and your wife, you just gotta keep at it! Have faith in yourself and your decisions and keep moving forwards.
Hey bud, sorry to hear. Shoot me a message and ill call ya tomorrow.  Things will work out my friend
With every hardship, surely there is ease.  Hang in there, the good times will come soon!
keep your chin up and stay strong
I hope things turn around in your favor and do what ever you have to do to take care of your self and your family just stay positive.

Life can be a  pain, can't use the B word here. Visit your local Children's hospital and then post back. I'm having a great day when I get vertical in the AM, and many others here. If you have your health you have it all. It's good to vent though. Vent away.
old ironmaker says it in simple terms. if ya get lemons make lemonade.
Sometimes the best view is looking upwards from below. You'll be right as rain in time Sir, don't despair.
We have all been there some way some how.  Some will sugar coat it. It is what it is.  Keep going John.
When you are at the top and looking down there is only one way to go. When you are at the bottom and looking up, there is only one way to go. Look up my friend, one step at a time!

John, you and I know it's not a better place for us at this point in time. Our girls maybe. Trudge forward, head high and it will all work out in the end.  As a good friend kept telling me "it's all a test". There are no study notes!

you know, i used to take everything to heart, and anything that happened to me was in some way an attack on on me, then I watched a movie called Van Wilder, and one quote has stuck with me, and I try to live by it, it's "Don't take life too seriously, no one gets out alive"  for every up, theres a down, for every down, theres an up. when you fall, land gracefully and build yourself back up, just don't look back
Life kicks you in the groin. Your job is to puke, get up, dust yourself off and move forward, one step at a time and you will go backwards at times. Keep at it.
Though deal bro.... Been there done that! You need to push ahead!  And if things get to bad..... IE food bank send me a pm....  G

Thank you and I will respond to u all tommorrow Ironmaker I was pleasantly surprised u responded, in all respect thx, you don't know my history but years ago I was at sick kids with my daughter and yes she passed away, and yes I buried someone very special that should have out lived me, so I have been there, in a nice way thx at least for responding, walked the walk with Wayne

You and Wayne are in a category that nobody should ever experience. Your ability to endure and succeed in spite of it makes you both stronger men than me. You will be rewarded.  I'm with Gerritt, if things get ugly, shoot me a message. Dave

No Mom or Dad should ever have to go what you two did. There has to be a better day and place somewhere down the line. Just because 2 people don't agree with one another or on their points of view has nothing to do with respect.
Grimsbylander thx pm you

Old Ironmaker thx I am sure we agree on many things, and I respect your many inputs to this great board, just one thing got misinterpreted, heck I might even join your football pool (thread) u were talking about like my 89 year old mother says repeatedly honey goes farther than viniger esp on the cooking thread, and it taste better too
Thanks for that John. Makes my day better. I will start that thread both NFL and CFL, heck everything Football.
I don't like hearing stuff like this.  If you weren't in Yellowknife, I'd say fishing, campfire and drinks at my cottage.  Keep your chin up.

That's a dark place to be ...I've been in over my head several times ...had it all ..had nothing ..it's a process state of mind is important it's not the weight of the world even thou it feels like it ...think things thru ,think clearly..make wise choices it all comes together
Well said NES
thought this to be appropriate
